about.background: Hi! My name is Raphael, I'm 21 years old and I'm a Data Analyst apprentice at L'AGEFI. Beyond lines of code and dashboards, I'm someone who has traveled the world to find my path.

chapters.title: The Early Years: Hong Kong
chapters.content: My story begins far from Paris. I grew up in Hong Kong, a city where East meets West, where skyscrapers stand alongside traditional temples. This international childhood taught me early on to navigate between cultures, to adapt, to stay curious. Perhaps that's where my taste for solving complex problems took root: when you grow up between several worlds, you learn to connect the dots differently.

chapters.title: The Dutch Adventure: Discovering AI
chapters.content: After high school, I headed to the Netherlands at the University of Groningen to study computer science and artificial intelligence. The courses on machine learning, algorithms, how data tells stories... I was fascinated. But the very academic approach didn't allow me enough hands-on experience, to create concrete things. I wanted to see the direct impact of my work.

chapters.title: Paris and ECE: The Turning Point
chapters.content: I joined ECE Paris for a more applied program. Team projects, real cases, the opportunity to develop applications that truly serve a purpose. I understood that it wasn't just coding that interested me, but solving concrete problems with technology. Creating tools that people actually use.

chapters.title: L'AGEFI: Tech in Service of Information
chapters.content: My apprenticeship at L'AGEFI has been an excellent school. A leading financial media outlet, expert journalists, and me having to understand their needs and create tools to automate their processes. I learned to speak business, to understand that a good technical tool is worthless if it doesn't address a real need. I automate newsletters, create analytics dashboards, develop document analysis systems. Every day, I see the impact of my work.

chapters.title: Today
chapters.content: I'm applying for Master's programs in Data Engineering while working on exciting projects: ML trading simulators, public health data analysis, automation systems. I know where I want to go: become a Data Engineer, then Senior, and why not one day Head of Data. But the journey is as important as the destination.
